greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k runs of even entries (n >= 2, 1 <= k <= floor(n/2)). For example, the permutation 321756498 has 3 runs of even entries: 2, 64 and 8.
comment: Sum of entries in row n is n! (=A000142(n)). Row n contains floor(n/2) entries.
example: T(4,2) = 12 because we have 1234, 3214, 1432, 3412, 2134, 2314 and their reverses.
maple: ae := proc (n, k) options operator, arrow: factorial(n)^2*binomial(n+1, k)*binomial(n-1, k-1) end proc: ao := proc (n, k) options operator, arrow: factorial(n)*factorial(n+1)*binomial(n-1, k-1)*binomial(n+2, k) end proc: T := proc (n, k) if `mod`(n, 2) = 0 then ae((1/2)*n, k) else ao((1/2)*n-1/2, k) end if end proc; for n to 12 do seq(T(n, k), k = 1 .. floor((1/2)*n)) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
